Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by Rabbi Avrohom Hecht, Jewish Community Council of Canarsie, Inc., 1170 Pennsylvania Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11239.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Fidler.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rabbi Avrohom Hecht, Jewish Community Council of Canarsie, Inc., 1170 Pennsylvania Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11239.

Council Member Fidler moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 29, 2011 be adopted as printed by Council Member Mark Viverito.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Mark-Viverito moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of November 29, 2011 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to providing public notice of productions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Providing public notice of productions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to defeat the Stop Online Piracy Act (“SOPA,” H.R. 3261) and the Preventing Real Online Threats to Economic Creativity and Theft of Intellectual Property Act (“Protect IP Act,” S. 968), which would greatly expand the potential for Internet censorship and place a significant burden on website administrators.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Congress to defeat the Stop Online Piracy Act (“SOPA,” H.R. 3261) and the Preventing Real Online Threats to Economic Creativity and Theft of Intellectual Property Act (“Protect IP Act,” S. 968).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring radio signal boosting devices in high rise buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring radio signal boosting devices in high rise buildings.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to enforce Chancellor’s Regulation A-801, which requires that students on school buses wear seat belts until the bus comes to a destination stop.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to enforce Chancellor’s Regulation A-801.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Act to allow private physicians and surgeons in high-risk specialties to purchase professional liability insurance from the Health and Hospitals Corporation (HHC) in exchange for minimal employment with HHC hospitals.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Amend the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation Act.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting S.1973, the Gun Trafficking Prevention Act of 2012, which would amend the United States Code by creating the crime of trafficking or assisting in the trafficking of  a firearm.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Supporting S.1973, the Gun Trafficking Prevention Act of 2012.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making the chaining, tying, or attaching of bicycles to street trees illegal.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Making the chaining, tying, or attaching of bicycles to street trees illegal.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting immediate towing of certain vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting immediate towing of certain vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution opposing the United State Supreme Court’s interpretation of the Constitution in Citizens United regarding the constitutional rights of corporations, supporting an amendment to the Constitution to provide that corporations are not entitled to the entirety of protections or “rights” of natural persons, specifically so that the expenditure of corporate money to influence the electoral process is no longer a form of constitutionally protected speech, and calling on Congress to begin the process of amending the Constitution.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Opposing the US Supreme Court’s interpretation of the Constitution in Citizens United.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to discharges in certain designated bodies of water.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Waterfronts
Items.MatterName: Discharges in certain designated bodies of water.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in six business improvement districts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing an increase in the amount to be expended in six business improvement districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to decreasing the number of vehicles required to qualify for base station license.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Decreasing the number of vehicles required to qualify for base station license.

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Westchester Square Business Improvement District in the Borough of the Bronx and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Westchester Square Business Improvement District, Bronx

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the increase in the annual expenditure for the 34th Street, the Grand Central,  the 125th Street, the Mosholu-Jerome-East Gun Hill Road, the Fordham Road and the Bayside Village  Business Improvement Districts, and the setting of the date, time and place for the hearing of the local law increasing the annual expenditure for such districts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Increase annual expediture of six BIDs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to noise levels in commercial and manufacturing districts.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Noise levels in commercial and manufacturing districts.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that agencies educate business owners on issues concerning access for persons with disabilities.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring that agencies educate business owners on issues concerning access for persons with disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Congressional Delegation to vote to disapprove H.R. 3630 which cuts federal unemployment benefits for long term unemployment and instead to support full renewal of the federal unemployment insurance program through 2012.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: NYC Congressional Delegation to vote to disapprove H.R. 3630 which cuts federal unemployment benefits for long term unemployment.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to post on its website pedestrian related project information accessible to people with disabilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOT to post on its website pedestrian related project information accessible to people with disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, relation to carbon monoxide alarms.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Carbon monoxide alarms.

Items.Title: Resolution condemning the overly aggressive actions of the Bloomberg Administration that were used to evict the Occupy Wall Street protestors that occurred in the predawn hours of November 15, 2011.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Condemning the overly aggressive actions of the Bloomberg Administration that were used to evict the Occupy Wall Street protestors.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Governor and the New York State Legislature to enact legislation establishing specific protections for children affected by the State’s transfer of authority to New York City for its own juvenile justice system (realignment), and for the Bloomberg Administration to release a detailed plan for implementing realignment and to ensure there is an adequate and transparent public comment process that allows public input to be incorporated into any final implementation plan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Juvenile Justice
Items.MatterName: Establishing specific protections for children affected by the State’s transfer of authority to NYC for its own juvenile justice system (realignment).

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Quinn), the President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera) adjourned to meet again for the Charter Meeting of January 4, 2012.



MICHAEL M. McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore (Council Member Rivera)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
Council Member Cabrera was Present but Not Voting in regard to the GO vote.
There were 48 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
